intro: Lithospermum hispidulum var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the hairy lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
